Module contents¶

app.create_app(**config_overrides)[source]¶

This is normal setup code for a Flask app, but we give the option to provide override configurations so that in testing, a different database can be used.

app.register_blueprints()[source]¶

Registers all the Blueprints (modules) in a function, to avoid circular dependancies.

Be careful rearranging the order of the app.register_blueprint() calls, as it can also result in circular dependancies.

app.register_delete_rules()[source]¶

Registers rules for how Mongoengine handles the deletion of objects that are being referenced by other objects.

See the documentation for mongoengine.model.register_delete_rule() for more information.

All delete rules for User fields must by DENY, because User objects should never be deleted. Lists of reference fields should PULL, to remove deleted objects from the list, and all others should NULLIFY

app.register_logger()[source]¶

Create an error logger and attach it to app.

app.register_scss()[source]¶

Registers the Flask-Assets rules for scss compilation. This reads from config/scss.json to make these rules.

We expire files using filenames: http://webassets.readthedocs.org/en/latest/expiring.html#expire-using-the-filename

app.run()[source]¶

Runs the app.
